entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage if salivating. If this damage reduces a creature to less than half of its maximum hit points, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength or Dexterity saving throw, or be {@condition restrained} by the maneater's jaws. A {@condition restrained} creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of each of each of the maneater's turns if it is salivating.

action.name: Swallow
entries: If the maneater is salivating, it attempts to swallow a medium or smaller creature it has {@condition restrained} with its jaws. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the maneater plant. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the maneater plant, and takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage at the start of each of the maneater's turns.

The maneater can only have one creature in its gullet. If it takes 20 damage or more in a single turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, or it spits out the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} within 10 feet of the maneater.

action.name: Salivate (1/Short Rest)
entries: The giant maneater plant uses its action to salivate, producing caustic saliva that dribbles out of its mouth. For the next minute, its bite attacks deal an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage, and any creature that begins its turn within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, a creature is immune to the sickening effect of its throat's stench for 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githyanki's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the githyanki warrior's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The githyanki makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire or psychic damage.

The githyanki plunder countless worlds from the decks of their astral vessels and the backs of red dragons. Feathers, beads, gems, and precious metals decorate their armor and weapons-the legendary silver swords with which they cut through their foes. Since winning their freedom from the mind flayers, the githyanki have become ruthless conquerors under the rulership of their dread lich-queen, Vlaakith.

entries.name: Astral Raiders
entries: The githyanki despise all other races, undertaking devastating raids that take them from their strongholds in the Astral Plane to the far flung corners of the multiverse. War is the ultimate expression of githyanki culture, and their pitiless black eyes know no mercy. After a raid, they leave shattered survivors enough food and resources to weakly endure. Later, the githyanki return to their conquered foes, plundering them again and again.

entries.name: Followers of Gith
entries: In their own language, githyanki means "followers of Gith." Under the guidance of Gith, the githyanki stratified into a militaristic society, with a strict caste system, dedicated to the ongoing fight against the victims and sworn enemies of their race. When their leader Gith perished, she was replaced by her undead adviser, Vlaakith. The lich-queen forbade worship of all beings except herself.

Of all their enemies, the githyanki most hate their former masters, the mind flayers. Their close kin, the githzerai, are second in their enmity. All other creatures are treated with simple contempt by the githyanki, whose xenophobic pride defines their view of inferior races.

entries.name: Silver Swords
entries: In ancient times, gith knights created special weapons to combat their mind flayer masters.

These silver swords channel the force of the wielder's will, dealing psychic as well as physical damage. A githyanki can't become a knight until it masters the singular discipline needed to will such a blade into existence. A silver sword is equivalent to a greatsword, and takes on the properties of a +3 greatsword in the hands of its creator.

In the eyes of the githyanki, each silver sword is a priceless relic and a work of art. Githyanki knights will hunt down and destroy any non-githyanki that dares to carry or wield a silver sword, reclaiming it for their people.

entries.name: Red Dragon Riders
entries: In the uprising against the illithids, Gith sought allies. Her adviser Vlaakith appealed to Tiamat, the goddess of evil dragonkind, and Gith ventured into the Nine Hells to meet with her. Only Tiamat now knows what passed between them, but Vlaakith returned to the Astral Plane with the Dragon Queen's red dragon consort Ephelomon, who proclaimed that his kind would forever act as allies to the githyanki. Not all red dragons honor the alliance kindled so long ago, but most at least don't consider the githyanki their enemies.

entries.name: Outposts in the Mortal Realm
entries: Since creatures that dwell on the Astral Plane don't age, the githyanki establish creches in remote areas of the Material Plane to raise their young. Doubling as military academies, these creches train young githyanki to harness their psychic and combat abilities. When a githyanki grows to adulthood and slays a mind flayer as part of a sacred rite of passage, it is permitted to rejoin its people on the Astral Plane.

entries.name: Gith
entries: The warlike githyanki and the contemplative githzerai are a sundered people-two cultures that utterly despise one another. Before there were githyanki or githzerai, these creatures were a single race enslaved by the mind flayers. Although they attempted to overthrow their masters many times, their rebellions were repeatedly crushed until a great leader named Gith arose.
After much bloodshed, Gith and her followers threw off the yoke of their illithid masters, but another leader named Zerthimon emerged in the aftermath of battle.

Zerthimon challenged Gith's motives, claiming that her strict martial leadership and desire for vengeance amounted to little more than another form of slavery for her people. A rift erupted between followers of each leader, and they eventually became the two races whose enmity endures to this day.

Whether these tall, gaunt creatures were peaceful or savage, cultured or primitive before the mind flayers enslaved and changed them, none can say. Not even the original name of their race remains from that distant time.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The godsram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ramming Charge
entries: If the godsram moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its ram on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the godsram.

trait.name: Shocking Horns (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the godsram hits a target with a ram attack, it can charge its horns with electricity. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute or until it succeeds on a repeated saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more at any point of the effect, it becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn, and the effect ends.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} lightning damage, and it becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of the godsram's next turn.

action.name: Lightning Bolt {@recharge 5}
entries: The godsram expells a bolt of lightning that forms a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

reaction.name: Static Release
entries: When a creature hits the godsram with an attack, it can release a surge of electricity in a 10-foot radius sphere around it. Any creatures in that area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Griffith's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Griffith can cast the following spells:

1e: {@spell zephyr strike|XGE} (once per turn until the spell ends)

trait.name: As Wind
entries: Whenever the griffith warrior makes an attack, it can move up to 5 feet without provoking any attacks of opportunity

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against Griffith. If a creature makes a ranged attack against Griffith, and it already has disadvantage from another source, the attack automatically misses.

Additionally, Griffith can use his bonus action to extinguish any flames within 15 feet of him. If the flames are created by a spell that is of third level or lower, the spell is immediately dispelled. If the spell's level is higher, Griffith makes a Dexterity check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level, ending the spell on a success.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Griffith is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Griffith instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails. If he succeeds, he can then use his Winded Stab.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Griffith makes three rapier attacks, or it makes six rapier attacks with disadvantage. If Griffith is mounted, he can make two lance attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft. (with disadvantage against a target within 5 ft.), one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Winded Stab
entries: When a weapon attack misses Griffith, or he succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw, he can use his reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see within range. That space must be adjacent to an enemy creature. After teleporting, the griffith warrior can make a rapier attack as part of the same reaction. On a hit, the griffith warrior deals an additional 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage.

legendary.name: Aerial Command
entries: Griffith commands a griffith warrior or rider he can see within 60 feet of him to make a weapon attack against a creature within its reach. If the griffith rider is mounted on a griffon, the griffon can also move up to half of its movement speed as part of the same action.

legendary.name: Call Griffon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Griffith calls a griffon which is mounted by a griffith rider. They arrive at the beginning of the next round and act at initiative count 20. Griffith can do so 3 times per day.

legendary.name: Wind Burst (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Griffith emits powerful gusts of wind in a 20-foot radius around him. Any enemy creatures in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 20 feet away from him, taking half as much damage and being pushed half as far on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The griffith rider has advantage on checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on its griffon.

action.name: Air Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the next melee attack against the creature has advantage until the creature's next turn.

action.name: Summon Whirlwind (Ritual: 3 Griffith Mages)
entries: Three Griffith mages that are within 30 feet of each other can attempt to collectively summon a whirlwind. Each must use its action to invoke the sacred rites, concentrating on the ritual. When it does so, each mage must make a Wisdom check. The result of each mage's roll is added to a pool of ritual points. When the pool reaches 100 points, the ritual is completed, and the mages cast the whirlwind spell together, which lasts until all mages lose concentration on it.

If a mage's concentration to the ritual or the active spell is broken, the ritual or the spell can continue as normal, but the mage cannot return its concentration to the effect unless the three mages begin the process anew. If a mage is ever more than 30 feet away from the other two mages, its concentration on the ritual is broken. After the mages have successfully performed the ritual, they can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

reaction.name: Wind Maneuvers
entries: When the griffith mage is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, it can use its reaction to gain advantage on the roll if it is outside. On a success, the mage takes no damage from the effect, if it would normally take half damage.

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against the griffith warrior.

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The griffith rider has advantage on checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on its griffon. If it falls, it can use its reaction to cast feather fall on itself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffith rider makes two lance attacks if it is mounted.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Sudden Wind
entries: When the rider's griffon is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, the griffith rider can use its reaction to grant advantage on its roll. If the griffon succeeds, the griffon and its riders take no damage from the effect, if they would normally take half damage.

trait.name: As Wind
entries: Whenever the griffith warrior makes an attack, it can move up to 5 feet without provoking any attacks of opportunity

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against the griffith warrior.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the griffith warrior is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the griffith warrior instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffith warrior makes two rapier attacks, or it makes four rapier attacks with disadvantage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Winded Stab
entries: When a weapon attack misses the griffith warrior, it can use its reaction to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see within range. That space must be adjacent to an enemy creature. After teleporting, the griffith warrior can make a rapier attack as part of the same reaction.

trait.name: Faithful Steed
entries: Griffith's griffon gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns if Griffith is on its back.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: Griffith's griffon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Griffith's griffon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the griffith's griffon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If Griffith's griffon flies at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a beak attack, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage to the target, and the target is unable to take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: At the start of its turn, the griffon can use its large wings to generate a massive wave of wind behind it. Each enemy creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Until the start of its next turn, the griffon has double its movement speed and ranged attacks against it have disadvantage.

legendary.name: Second Wind
entries: Griffith's griffon rolls to recharge its Wing Burst. On a success, the griffon regains {@dice 1d10 + 6} hit points.

legendary.name: Wing Burst
entries: The griffon uses its Wing Burst, if it is available, and flies up to 80 feet.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The grim shrieker can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}. If the grim shrieker takes more than 20 thunder damage from a single source, it becomes {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the grim shrieker moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature before hitting it with a bite attack, the creature takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage, and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Swift Flyer's Evasion
entries: Attacks made with disadvantage against the grim shrieker automatically miss.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the shrieker bites a {@condition stunned} creature, it is a critical hit, and the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is medium or smaller.

action.name: Sonic Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The grim shrieker lets out a sonic shriek in a 30-foot cone in front of it. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or take 17 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage and become {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature takes half as much damage on a success, and does not become {@condition stunned}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grinning angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). It can cast the following spells without requiring any components:

trait.name: Harbringer of Doom
entries: Whenever a creature within 20 feet of the angel takes damage, it takes an extra 10 damage if the angel isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Additionally, the grinning angel has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have at least one failed death saving throw. It can perceive the presence of these creatures unerringly within 1 mile of it.
Variant: Creatures within 1 mile of the grinning angel have disadvantage on death saving throws.

trait.name: Inevitable Defeat
entries: When an attack misses the grinning angel, the attacker takes 5 psychic damage and the Angel's AC increases by 1. The angel's AC resets at the end of each of its turns.

trait.name: Powerful Presence
entries: The grinning angel can't be moved or teleported against its will, and it is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. It also can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Debilitating Aura
entries: At the start of the grinning angel's turn, any creatures within 20 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw, or take {@damage 5d8} psychic damage.

If a creature fails its save by 5 or more ({@dc 15}), it becomes {@condition frightened} of the angel until targeted by a spell such as lesser restoration. If a creature fails its save by 10 or more ({@dc 10}), it becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If a creature rolls below that, it is also {@condition paralyzed} while it is {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Angelic Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution or Charisma saving throw, or gain a failed death saving throw, even while it is conscious. A creature that has a failed death saving throw in this way must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns until it reaches 3 successes or 3 failures. If it reaches 3 failures, it dies. If it reaches 3 successes, the effect for it ends.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: The grinning angel teleports to an unoccupied place it can see within 60 feet of it.

monster.name: Gunmetal

from: +1 glamoured studden leather; 20 against ranged attacks

trait.name: Bullet Points
entries: Gunmetal has a maximum of 3 bullet points. At the start of his turn, he rolls {@dice 1d3} and regains that many expended bullet points. When he makes a Gun Metal attack, he can expend 1 bullet point to activate one of the following effects. Gunmetal can't use any bullet points if he has disadvantage on the attack roll.
Incendiary Bullet. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage. Any creatures within 5 feet of the target take half as much fire damage.
Sparking Bullet. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

Swift Bullet. Gunmetal can move up to half of his movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity before he makes his attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

Boom Bullet. On a hit, the bullet produces a shockwave in a 15-foot cone behind the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Each creature in the cone takes half as much damage. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and no other creature is affected.
Debilitating Bullet. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage, and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of Gunmetal's next turn.
Precision Bullet. If gunmetal has disadvantage on the attack roll, he makes a normal attack roll instead, and on a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage.

trait.name: Rapid Fire
entries: When Gunmetal scores a critical hit, he can choose to gain 1 bullet point or use his bonus action to make a Gun Metal attack.

actionHeader: Gunmetal makes three Gun Metal attacks.

action.name: Gun Metal
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Reactionary Fire
entries: When an attack misses gunmetal, he can use his reaction to expend a bullet point and make a Gun Metal attack against his attacker. Additional bullet points can be spent for the attack as usual.

trait.name: Survival Points
entries: Hardin has 5 Survival points which he can use to add or subtract from an attack roll, damage roll or saving throw. Hardin must be within 5 feet of a target in order to do so. Hardin regains any expended points at the start of each of his turns.

action.name: Hindering Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage, and the target takes another 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if they move before the end of their next turn.

bonus.name: Deploy Trap (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Hardin deploys a 10-foot wide trap on an unoccupied space within 30 feet of him which must be on the ground. A creature that steps on the trap must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and become {@condition restrained}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition restrained}.
Once Hardin has used this ability, he can't do so again until he completes a short or long rest, unless he expends 5 survival points to do so.

trait.name: Mode Selection
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the heavyarm can select its Defense, Assault, Artilery, or Mobile mode.
Defense. The heavyarm gains a +2 bonus to its AC and a damage reduction of 3.
Assault. The heavyarm can make three metal strikes using its Multiattack, and attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.
Artillery. The heavyarm can make two artillery strike attacks using its Multiattack, and its ranged attacks ignore all cover except total cover.

Mobile. The heavyarm's speed increases by 10 feet and if it makes an attack during its turn, the heavyarm doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity from its target for the rest of its turn. The heavyarm can also use 5 of its movement speed to get up from the {@condition prone} position.
Artifice. The heavyarm can use its bonus action to summon a drone (Recharge 5-6).

trait.name: Brutal Strike (1/turn)
entries: When the heavyarm hits a creature that has fewer hit points than it has with a melee attack, it can roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or more, the attack deals an extra damage die. This damage die automatically activates a Metal Strike effect, even if it isn't a 10.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The heavyarm enforcing unit is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, and the haste and slow spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heavyarm makes two metal strike attacks.

action.name: Metal Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the heavyarm rolls a 10 on any of the damage dice, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be inflicted with one of the following effects until the end of its next turn:
- the target has disadvatage on attack rolls
- the target is knocked {@condition prone}
- the target can't use reactions
- the target is {@condition grappled}.
The heavyarm can inflict an additional effect for each 10 it has rolled. The heavyarm also automatically inflicts an effect on a critical hit.

action.name: Artillery Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage. Select the highest rolled damage die. Each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take that much damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hell raiser has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hell raiser has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hell raiser's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The hell raiser doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hell raiser makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Branded Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and the hell raiser can choose one of the following:
The target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of its next turn. These dice can stack.
The target can't receive magical healing until the end of the hell raiser's next turn.

bonus.name: Tactical Maneuvers
entries: If the hell raiser uses its action to attack a creature while benefiting from its Pack Tactics trait, it can use its bonus action to grapple or shove the creature. The hell raiser must be able to use its fly speed in order to do so.

reaction.name: Dive
entries: If the hell raiser is flying when it is targeted by a ranged attack, it can use its reaction to dive, adding 2 to its AC against the triggering attack as it descends 30 feet in a direction of its choice. If it reaches the ground, it lands safely.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hollow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, including effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Soul Drain
entries: When the hollow reduces a creature to 0 hit points, any creatures within 30 feet of the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage and suffer the effects of the slow spell until the end of their next turn.
In addition, the hollow gains an equal amount of temporary hit points and it can move up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Chill and Shadow
entries: At the start of its turn, the hollow can choose whether to imbue its blade with shadowy or chill energy. This affects the type of the extra damage it deals with its hollow blade (included in the attack), the effects of its Nether Infusion bonus action, and what reactions it can take.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hollow makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Hollow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic or cold damage. If the attack deals cold damage, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn, while if the attack deals necrotic damage, the hollow regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The hollow turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell. It remains {@condition invisible} only while it is under dim light or darkness. If it is ever under bright light, the effect ends.

bonus.name: Nether Infusion {@recharge 5}
entries: When the hollow hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can make its weapon reverberate with cold energy. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold or necrotic damage. On a success, the target takes half as much damage.

On a failure, the target is also unable to regain any hit points until the end of the hollow's next turn (Chill) or its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the extra damage dealt (Shadow).

reaction.name: Cold Shroud (Chill)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the hollow targets it with an attack, the hollow can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll if its blade is infused with chill energy. If the attack misses, the target's speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of its turn.

trait.name: Ignan Nature
entries: When the ignant wolf takes fire damage, it immediately recharges its flame breath and ignan step abilities.

Additionally, when it makes an attack roll against an ignited target, it can either choose to have advantage on the attack roll, or gain temporary hit points equal to half of the fire damage it deals on a hit.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be set on fire.

While ignited, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The fire is extinguished through normal means such as water, or by a character using its action to succeed on a {@dc 14} ability check of the DM's discretion. On a failure, the creature puts out the fire but takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage in the process.

action.name: Flame Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The ignant wolf breathes flame in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage and be ignited as per the wolf's bite attack. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't ignited.

bonus.name: Ignan Step {@recharge 5}
entries: The ignant wolf teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it, surrounding in flames both when it departs as well as when it arrives. Each creature within 5 feet of its point of origin and its destination must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The commander casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The infernal fleet commander has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commander makes two attacks.

action.name: Infernal Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage. On a critical hit, the target is also knocked {@condition prone} and any creatures of the commander's choice within 5 feet of the target take 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on failed {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120/300 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage. On a critical hit, a creature is set on fire for 1 minute. At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. It can make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If the target takes cold damage, it has advantage on the next saving throw it makes to end this effect.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The commander teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. The commander can take up to willing two creatures within it when it teleports.

bonus.name: Infernal Smite {@recharge 5}
entries: When the commander hits a creature with an attack, it can empower the attack with infernal power. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also surrounded by hellish flames until the commander recharges this ability. If the target willingly moves 5 or more feet before then, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The commander adds 5 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the commander must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The commander targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the commander, the target can make one melee weapon attack using its reaction, if available, and has advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Attack (2 Actions)
entries: The commander makes one attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The commander uses its teleport action.
Supreme commanders lead armies, each one commanding ten kith'raks, who in turn lead the rest of their forces. Most supreme commanders ride {@creature adult red dragon||red dragons} into battle.

entries.name: Githyanki
entries: Githyanki descend from an ancient people who were also the progenitors of githzerai (also in this book). These tall, gaunt folk have potent psionic powers and dwell, for the most part, on the Astral Plane. Among the best-known githyanki are the bellicose followers of the Lich Queen Vlaakith. They terrorize the Astral Plane, raiding into other planes to plunder the multiverse of its magic and riches.

trait.name: See Invisibility
entries: The viper can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The {@condition invisible} viper has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Poison Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 8d4}) poison damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, or until it succeeds on a repeated saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A {@condition poisoned} creature also becomes {@condition invisible}.

action.name: Greater Invisibility
entries: The viper magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Irfirria's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). She can cast the following spells:

5: {@spell far step|XGE} (any creature in the path takes 2d8 fire damage)

trait.name: Fire Skin
entries: Whenever a creature hits Irfirria with an attack while within 5 feet of her takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. A creature that begins its turn grappling or touching her takes the same damage.

trait.name: Ember
entries: For each ember point a creature has, Irfirria deals an extra 1 fire damage to it when she hits it with Ember.
A creature gains one ember point whenever Irfirria deals fire damage to it. When Irfirria affects a creature with a spell, it also gains a number of ember points equal to the spell's level.

trait.name: Fire Sense
entries: Irfirria can sense any open fire or source of heat within 60 feet of her, including the body heat radiating from living creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Irfirria makes three attacks with Ember, her flame-tongue scimitar.

action.name: Ember
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Fiery Puff
entries: When Irfirria is hit by a melee attack, she can use her reaction to vanish in a flare and appear in an unoccupied space that she can see within 30 feet of her. Any creatures within 5 feet from the point she vanished take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: Prismatic Sense
entries: The ward has an innate connection with light and its prismatic nature. It can innately cast the light spell without requiring an action.

While in bright light, the ward has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are seeing double, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, the iridescent ward's movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: When the iridescent ward takes radiant damage, its attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage until the end of its next turn. Additionally, it can refract the light with its shield. A creature of its choice within 30 feet of the ward succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or begin Seeing Double.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The iridescent ward makes two scimitar attacks. If it scores a critical hit, it can make an additional shimmering scimitar attack. The ward can only use its shimmering scimitar if it is in bright light.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shimmering Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or begin Seeing Double. If the ward hits with this attack, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it can't use this action again unless its Multiattack allows it to.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Kar'kul'ar's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Psionic Arms
entries: The Kar'kul'ar has 4 arms and can take an equal number of reactions. A creature can target one of its arms with an attack, severing it if it deals 30 or more damage with a single roll. This damage still counts against the Kar'kul'ar's hit point count.

trait.name: Mental Feedback (1/Round)
entries: When the Kar'kul'ar makes an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma save, it can choose to gain advantage on the roll. On a success, the caster of the spell receives mental feedback, taking {@damage 6d6} psychic damage on a failed {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw.

action.name: Mental Assault
entries: The Kar'kul'ar chooses a number of creatures it can see equal to the arms it currently has. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. If a creature fails by 5 or more ({@dc 13}), it rolls a {@dice d4} and gains a corresponding condition until the end of its next turn:
1. {@condition blinded}
2. {@condition stunned}
3. its speed becomes 0
4. {@condition charmed}
5. {@condition frightened}
6. it comes under the effects of the confusion spell

bonus.name: Telekinetic Control
entries: As a bonus action, the Kar'kul'ar attempts to telepathically move a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength save or be pulled up to 20 feet in a direction of the Kar'kul'ar's choice. For each arm that the Kar'kul'ar is missing, this distance is reduced by 5 feet.

reaction.name: Telepathic Whelm
entries: When the Kar'kul'ar sees a creature within 60 feet of it make an attack roll, it can impose disadvantage on the roll. If the creature misses, it takes 6 psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The centaur warrunner has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the centaur warrunner is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the centaur warrunner is unaffected. On a 6, the centaur warrunner is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the centaur warrunner, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Tarrasque Weapons
entries: The centaur champion deals double damage to objects and structures and takes half damage from impacts with objects. Additionally, the champion's attacks are magical.

If the champion hits a structure with a gauntlet attack and reduces it to 0 hit points, any creatures in a 30-foot cone behind the object must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take half as much damage as the structure took and be knocked {@condition prone}, as debris rains down on them. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the centaur champion can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature or structure that it can see. If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If the champion charges towards a structure, it can attempt to run through it the same time it makes any other attacks. The champion makes a Strength (Athletics) check against the AC of the structure. On a success, the champion deals 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage to it, while on a failure, the champion takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) bludgeoning damage (already doubled and halved).

trait.name: Tarrasque Gravity
entries: The area in a 15-foot radius around the champion is difficult terrain for any of its enemies that tries to move away from the champion. Any creature that tries to stand up from the {@condition prone} condition while in that area must expend all of its movement speed to do so.

Additionally, the ground quakes when the kentavric champion moves. When the champion moves within 15 feet of a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The champion's hooves are audible out to 300 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes three attacks: two with its pike and one with its hooves. It can substitute any of these attacks with a grapple attack.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A creature that is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack is impaled on the pike.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage or 34 ({@damage 8d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is pushed 30 feet away from the champion and knocked {@condition prone}. If it impacts against an object, the target and the object take {@damage 1d6} damage for each 10 feet the target moved before the impact.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The champion makes a pike attack, or it makes a gauntlet attack (Costs 2 Actions).

legendary.name: Move
entries: The champion moves up to its movement speed. It can take additional legendary actions at the same time.

legendary.name: Hoove Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The champion slams its hooves on the ground, creating a quake in a 30-foot radius around it. Any creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature adjacent to the champion also takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

The Kentavric tribe took its form shortly after the death of Kashud, the mass that ends. After the Tarrasque fell, the shards of the nearly completely broken world began to stir and reorganize themselves. El-Ashud was among the first to approach the god's still corpse.

Competing with the Dwarves of Ardun, and others, El-Ashud created a tribe that managed to carve out a significant chunk of the dead god's skin, empowering themselves. The skin of the dead god granted them protective powers, filled them with strength that threatened to tear their bodies apart, but also whispered alien guttural words to the ears of a chosen few.  Promising his ever expanding hoard of new warriors endless conquering, the Tarrasque's massive body still rules and determines the outcome of this world, already broken by its stomping.

entries: Halahdra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time Halahdra is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the centaur warrunner is unaffected. On a 6, the centaur warrunner is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the centaur warrunner, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The champion makes a pike attack, or it makes a gauntlet attack (Costs 2 Actions).

legendary.name: Move
entries: The champion moves up to its movement speed. It can take additional legendary actions at the same time.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The centaur warrunner deals double damage to objects and structures.

If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a greatsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its hooves. It can substitute its hooves attack with a shove attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage or 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its hooves.

action.name: Greatsword

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.
