spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The krikatuul's spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 15}). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The krikatuul succulent can't be affected or detected by spells of 4th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Eldritch Mind
entries: The krikatuul succulent has advantage on concentration checks and is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

action.name: Sapping Stings
entries: The krikatuul saps the vitality of up to {@dice 1d3 + 1} creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Succulent Beam
entries: The krikatuul targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it with an energy beam that sucks all vitality out of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is encased in the beam and {@condition incapacitated} while it remains there. At the start of each of the krikatuul's turns, the creature takes 34 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage, and the krikatuul regains half as many hit points. A creature can pull or push the target out of the beam by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength check. On a failure, it takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage and the creature remains suspended in the beam. The beam is also disrupted if the krikatuul's concentration on it is broken, as if concentrating on a spell.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The lich knight is immune to effects that turn undead. When it is subjected to such an effect by a creature, it can use its reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the creature if it is within range.

trait.name: Arcane Resistance
entries: The lich knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. While the lich knight has temporary hit points, it is immune to spells of 3rd level or lower.

trait.name: Aura of Death
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the lich knight must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also unable to regain hit points until the start of its next turn, and if a creature fails its saving throw by 10 or more, the lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, creatures that make a death saving throw within 1 mile of the lich knight automatically fail on the roll.

trait.name: Severing Weapons
entries: When the lich knight scores a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or die. The lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to the creature's level or CR.

trait.name: Disruptive Weapons
entries: When the lich knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, it has disadvantage on any Concentration checks it makes as a result of taking damage. If the target fails to maintain concentration on a spell, it takes {@dice 1d6} of force damage for each level of the spell,

trait.name: Culling Weapons
entries: The lich knight's weapon attacks are magical. At the start of its turn, the lich knight can select its Severing Weapons or Disruptive Weapons trait to be active, changing the color of the aura its greatsword exudes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lich knight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword of Souls
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the lich knight regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points with this attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or die, and the lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to the target's level or CR. The target then rises as a greater zombie at the start of the lich knight's next turn.

action.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: The lich knight targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it with its dead gaze. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Spell's Rebuke
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the lich knight casts a spell, the lich knight can use its reaction to make a greatsword attack against it. On a hit, the target must make a Concentration check to maintain the spell, or the casting fails.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The lich knight makes a Wisdom (Perception) check. When it does so, it can see {@condition invisible} creatures or objects until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The lich knight makes a greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich knight uses its paralyzing gaze.

legendary.name: Dispelling Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The lich knight makes a greatsword attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage, and any spell of 5th level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 6th level or higher on the target, the lich knight makes a Charisma check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.
Lair Actions

monster.name: Lightning Elemental
actionHeader: The lightning elemental makes two lightning arc attacks. If both attacks hit, or if the elemental scores a critical hit with one, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Lightning Arc
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: A lightning storm swells out from the elemental, swallowing each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere from the elemental. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Call Lightning {@recharge 4}
entries: A bolt of lightning flashes down from the sky to a point within 60 feet of the elemental. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Never Gonna Give It Up.
entries: The maddened abomination can't be reduced below 1 hit point. If it starts its turn with 1 hit point, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it doesn't take any actions during its turn.

trait.name: Charger.
entries: The maddened abomination can move 2 feet for each foot of movement speed it spends if it is moving straight towards an enemy.
If the abomination moves 30 feet straight towards an enemy and then hits it with a Slam attack, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Maddened Rejuvenation
entries: The maddened abomination regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns. It gains an additional hit point for each creature it can see that has the maddened tag.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target has disadvantage on any Concentration checks it makes as a result of taking this damage.

trait.name: Mental Chaos
entries: The reaper has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. When the reaper succeeds on one of these saving throws, it gains a random chaotic mutation until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Reap Mind
entries: Once a target has been hit by the reaper's reap attack, the reaper can target it again with it, even if the creature is out of range or sight. The creature must be within 60 feet of the reaper, and the damage dealt becomes psychic. If the reaper hits another creature with this attack, the effect ends on the previous target.

If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or it becomes a maddened abomination until it is subjected to the remove curse spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Chaotic Mutation
entries: At the start of each of the maddened reaper's turns, roll {@dice 1d8}. The effect lasts until the start of the reaper's next turn.
1. Ablative Armor. The reaper's AC increases by 2. Whenever a creature hits it with an attack, it increases by an additional 1.
2. Tentacles. The first time a creature hits the reaper while within 5 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or be {@condition grappled} by the reaper.
3. Giant. The reaper's size becomes large. Its reap attack's reach becomes 15 feet, and it can target 2 creatures with it.
4. Disruptive Field. Any creature within 5 feet of the reaper is unable to maintain concentration.
5. Stabbing Cherub. A small stabbing cherub forms on the reaper's shoulder. Whenever a creature enters or leaves the reach of the reaper, the cherub deals 10 damage to the creature.
6. Haste. The reaper's speed is doubled and does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The reaper has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and Evasion.
7. Maddening Influence. The reaper targets a creature it can see within 60 feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or it becomes a maddened abomination for the duration.
8. The reaper regains 20 hit points, or 50 hit points if it was dead and immediately becomes active. For the duration, it can't be reduced below 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reaper makes two reap attacks.

action.name: Reap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Arcane Evasion
entries: The manaform hellkite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. When it makes a saving throw against a magical effect that allows it to take half damage, it takes no damage on a successful save, and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Manaform Aura
entries: The hellkite emits a manaform aura in a 30-foot radius. Any creature in its aura has disadvantage on Concentration checks and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw each time it attempts to cast a spell, or the casting is wasted.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hellkite makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mana Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 8d6 + 4}) force damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or lose one of its spell slots at random as the hellkite feeds on it. On a failure, the hellkite also regains 5 hit points for each level of the spell it consumed.

reaction.name: Arcane Absorption
entries: When a creature within the hellkite's manaform aura fails to successfully cast a spell, the hellkite can use its reaction to absorb the errant energy. The caster takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell, and the hellkite gains an equal amount of temporary hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The maul paragon is a 17th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: The paragon scores a critical hit on a roll of 19-20 on the {@dice d20} when it attacks with its mole. When the maul paragon scores a critical hit with its maul or hits a target with all three of its attacks during its turn, the target becomes staggered until the end of its next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

trait.name: Thunderous Smites
entries: When the maul paragon hits with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot and cause its maul to boom with thunderous energy. The attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage for each level of the spell slot expended, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the paragon and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul paragon makes three maul attacks. Alternatively, it can use its swiping swing if it is available and then make a maul attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) if the target is staggered.

action.name: Swiping Swing {@recharge 4}
entries: The maul warrior swipes its maul against all creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Active Leadership
entries: The paragon targets an ally under its command within 30 feet of it and shouts words of encouragement or direction. The creature gains one of the following benefits:
Attack. The target makes one weapon attack.
Shake It Off. If an effect is causing the target to be {@condition frightened}, it can immediately repeat the saving throw to end the condition on itself with advantage.
Brace Yourself. The target gains 10 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Head Cracker (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The maul warrior moves up to its speed and makes one maul attack. On a hit, the warrior can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw instead of a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the maul warrior's next turn.
If a creature is staggered, the hit is a critical hit and the target has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The maul paragon casts a spell and then makes a maul attack.

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: When the maul veteran scores a critical hit with a maul attack against a creature, the target is staggered until the end of the veteran's next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the creature is staggered.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: When the maul warrior scores a critical hit with its maul or hits a target with all three of its attacks during its turn, the target becomes staggered until the end of its next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

trait.name: Shaft Reach
entries: The maul warrior can attack targets within 10 feet of its reach. When it does so, it has disadvantage on the attack roll. The maul warrior can't do so if it would already have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul warrior makes three maul attacks. Alternatively, it can use its swiping swing if it is available and then make a maul attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the maul warrior can force the target to make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet away from the warrior (the maul warrior's choice).

action.name: Swiping Swing {@recharge 4}
entries: The maul warrior swipes its maul against all creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Head Cracker
entries: The maul warrior moves up to its speed and makes one maul attack. On a hit, the warrior can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw instead of a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the maul warrior's next turn.
If a creature is staggered, the hit is a critical hit and the target has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mirroring aberration's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells without requiring any components:

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The mirroring aberration is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Mirroring Form
entries: When the mirroring aberration takes damage, it can create a copy of the opponent's means of destruction and use it for itself. When it takes damage, the mirroring aberration can switch the damage of its Mirroring Attack to the type of the damage it took until it uses this trait again. If the damage was dealt by an attack, the mirroring aberration can also copy the mode of the attack, melee or ranged, for its Mirroring Attack as well.
For example, if the mirroring aberration is hit by an arrow, it can cause its mirroring attack fire back an arrow as well. The attack has the same reach, range and properties of the original attack.

trait.name: Mirror Step (1/round)
entries: At any point during a round, the mirroring aberration can steal the place of another creature, perfectly mimicking its appearance. The mirroring aberration targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, or the two creatures switch places, each teleporting to the other's last position. The switch is impossible to detect with the naked eye. When the aberration appears, it can choose to take on the appearance of the target it switched places with. The mirroring aberration may do so at any time without using an action, though it may only do so once per turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aberration makes two mirroring attacks or casts a mirrored spell.

action.name: Mirroring Attack
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach ? ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) damage of the type determined by Mirroring Form.

reaction.name: Mirrored Spell (1/day)
entries: When the mirrored aberration is targeted or affected by a spell, it can use its reaction to imprint the arcane form in its memory. Until the end of its next turn, the aberration can cast the spell once using its own spellcasting ability. The spell must be of 3rd level or lower.

monster.name: Mother Ooze

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The mother ooze regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Mother Brood
entries: The mother ooze has an average of 5 ({@dice 2d4}) oozes it has duplicated. When an ooze is within 5 feet of the mother ooze, the mother gains a +1 to its saving throws for each ooze around it. An ooze is reabsorbed into the mother when one ooze walks into the space of the other. When this occurs, the mother ooze regains as many hit points as the ooze had.

trait.name: Casting Off (Mythic Trait)
entries: When the mother ooze is reduced to 0 hit points, it casts off its dead surface layer and hatches its second form.

trait.name: Caustic Touch
entries: When a creature touches or hits the mother ooze with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 5 acid damage.

actionHeader: The mother ooze makes one pseudopod attack against each creature within its reach.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) acid damage.

action.name: Acidic Launch
entries: The mother ooze lobs {@dice 1d3 + 1} blobs of acid at different points it can see within 120 feet of it. Each point must be at least 30 feet away from the mother ooze. Each creature within 5 feet of each point must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage, taking half as much damage on a success. A creature in the area of more than one acid explosion is affected only once.

Creatures in melee with the mother ooze can use their reaction to make an attack of opportunity when the mother ooze uses its Acidic Launch. If an attack that hits deals slashing damage, the attacker can choose to slash at the blob of ooze being launched instead, reducing the damage that explosion deals by an amount equal to the damage of its attack.

action.name: Hibernate {@recharge}
entries: The mother ooze spends its turn in a short form of hibernation. It can't take any actions, move or take reactions until the start of its next turn when the hibernation ends. At the start of its next turn, the mother ooze regains 50 hit points.

bonus.name: Duplication {@recharge 4}
entries: The mother ooze can spend 10 hit points to spawn an ooze within 5 feet of it. The ooze is a small creature with 10 hit points and an AC of 10. It can attack with its pseudopod ({@hit 4} to hit, 5 acid damage) and all of its ability score modifiers are +0. It has a speed of 20 feet and acts immediately after the ooze mother.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The mother ooze makes a pseudopod attack, or launches a single acid blob with its acidic launch.

legendary.name: Digest
entries: If no hostile creature is within 5 feet of the mother ooze, it can attempt to recharge its hibernation action. If it succeeds, it can then move up to its speed.

legendary.name: Feeding Time (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mother ooze can restore up to a total of 20 hit points, divided as it chooses among any oozes within 5 feet of it.

legendary.name: Brood Orders (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mother ooze commands each ooze to make a pseudopod attack. Each ooze can move up to its movement speed before making the attack.

monster.name: Mother Ooze (Second Form)

trait.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The mother ooze takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the mother ooze's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the mother ooze can be seen but have total cover.

A creature within 5 feet of the mother ooze can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the mother ooze. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 18} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) acid damage.
The mother ooze can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

actionHeader: The mother ooze makes one pseudopod attack against each creature within its reach. The mother ooze can't target creatures it has engulfed.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) acid damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

legendary.name: Pseudopod
entries: The ooze makes a pseudopod attack.

legendary.name: Engulf (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The mother ooze uses its engulf action.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the mountain goat-lion moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its horns on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Great Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Winter Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The goat-lion lets out a breath of the winter wilds. Each creature within 30 feet of the goat-lion must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn, as the cold overtakes it. Afterwards, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute or until it succeeds on the same saving throw repeated at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Hooves
entries: When a creature makes a melee attack against the goat-lion while within 5 feet of it, the goat-lion can attempt to counter-strike with its hooves. The attack takes place before the enemy's attack, and if the enemy fails its saving throw, it loses the attack.

trait.name: Consumption
entries: When the mouthclaw reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a mouthclaw attack, it begins consuming it. The creature becomes {@condition restrained} in the mouthclaw's mouth, and takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage at the start of each of the mouthclaw's turns. When the creature dies, the mouthclaw fully digests it, absorbing all of its memories and knowledge in the process. Another creature can pull the target out of the mouth by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Magic-Resistant Carapace
entries: Spell attack rolls against the mouthclaw are made with disadvantage. On a hit, the mouthclaw takes half as much damage from them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mouthclaw makes two mouthclaw attacks.

action.name: Mouthclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

The mouthclaws are an aberrant species born long ago by a magocracy that sought to discover a species that would not only be the apex predator in any environment, but would also fit and thrive in any circumstance. After a number of centuries, the experiment run amok, and the mouthclaw was created: a species with the unique ability to consume a creature's memories and knowledge, and the hardiness to survive long enough stretches of time in order to make use of it.

No one clearly knows the intelligence level that the mouthclaws have acquired, since they seem to have no intention of communicating if they are able to speak language, but their behavior and planning seems to be highly capable.

Frightened of their capacity to take over any territory, the magocracy sealed the mouthclaws away in the patch of the land that they had up until then spread to, forbidding any passage in or out for centuries.

The magocracy has long since perished, and the protective runes have lost their old meaning to the new denizens of the lands. Believing there to be ancient tombs hiding ancient artifacts behind the ruins, adventuring parties have tampered with the seals and delved into the caverns that used to be the mouthclaw's sealed domain.
How have the mouthclaws changed throughout the centuries that have passed, and how will their first acquaintance with the new humans be?

trait.name: Consumption
entries: When the mouthclaw reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a mouthclaw attack, it begins consuming it. The creature becomes {@condition restrained} in the mouthclaw's mouth, and takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage at the start of each of the mouthclaw's turns. When the creature dies, the mouthclaw fully digests it, absorbing all of its memories and knowledge in the process. Another creature can pull the target out of the mouth by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Magic-Resistant Carapace
entries: Spell attack rolls against the mouthclaw are made with disadvantage. On a hit, the mouthclaw takes half as much damage from them. Additionally, the mouthclaw has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects of 3rd level or lower.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the mouthclaw protector moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a mouthclaw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the mouthclaw protector can make one appendage lock attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mouthclaw makes two mouthclaw attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the mouthclaw can use its charge trait against the target even if it doesn't move towards it.

action.name: Mouthclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Appendage Lock
entries: The mouthclaw protector tries to grapple and restrain a creature within 5 feet of it with its mouth. The target must succeed on a contented Strength (Athletics) check with the protector or become {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} by it (escape {@dc 16}). While grappling a creature in this way, the protector can only attack that creature with its attacks and it deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage to it with its attacks. The protector can use a bonus action to release a creature from its mouth.

reaction.name: Take the Hit
entries: When another mouthclaw that isn't a protector is hit by an attack, the protector can use its reaction to be targeted by the attack instead if both the attacker and its normal target are within 5 feet of the protector.

The mouthclaws are an aberrant species born long ago by a magocracy that sought to discover a species that would not only be the apex predator in any environment, but would also fit and thrive in any circumstance. How have the mouthclaws changed throughout the centuries that have passed, and how will their first acquaintance with the new humans be?

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mouthclaw psion's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components. If the psion consumes a creature that has the ability to cast spells, the next time the psion completes a short rest it can replace one of the spells it can cast with a spell that the creature was able to cast.

trait.name: Consumption
entries: When the mouthclaw reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a mouthclaw attack, it begins consuming it. The creature becomes {@condition restrained} in the mouthclaw's mouth, and takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage at the start of each of the mouthclaw's turns. When the creature dies, the mouthclaw fully digests it, absorbing all of its memories and knowledge in the process. Another creature can pull the target out of the mouth by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Magic-Resistant Carapace
entries: Spell attack rolls against the mouthclaw are made with disadvantage. On a hit, the mouthclaw takes half as much damage from them. Additionally, the mouthclaw has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mouthclaw makes two mouthclaw attacks.

action.name: Mouthclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Consumption
entries: When the mouthclaw reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a mouthclaw attack, it begins consuming it. The creature becomes {@condition restrained} in the mouthclaw's mouth, and takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage at the start of each of the mouthclaw's turns. When the creature dies, the mouthclaw fully digests it, absorbing all of its memories and knowledge in the process. Another creature can pull the target out of the mouth by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Magic-Resistant Carapace
entries: Spell attack rolls against the mouthclaw are made with disadvantage. On a hit, the mouthclaw takes half as much damage from them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mouthclaw makes two mouthclaw attacks. It can substitute any of these attacks with a spit attack.

action.name: Mouthclaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) acid damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Acid Belch {@recharge 5}
entries: The mouthclaw spitter launches a torrent of psychic acid in a 30-foot cone or a line that is 5 feet wide and 90 feet long in a direction of its choice. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage on failure, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that failed its saving throw is also coated in saliva that contains the mouthclaw's pheromones. Mouthclaws have advantage on attack rolls against the creature and on ability checks made to locate or track its movements until a creature uses an action to swipe the saliva away.

reaction.name: Skitter
entries: When an attack against the mouthclaw misses, it can use its reaction to move up to half of its movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mytria's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). She can cast the following spells at 3rd level.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Mytria has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dark Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, Mytria chooses or determines randomly an effect:
1. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage and  it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes.
2. The target takes {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check it makes.
3. The target takes {@damage 3d4} necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn.
4. The target takes {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Hex (Recharges on a Short or Long rest)
entries: Mytria silently hexes a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with an ability Mytria chooses, and whenever it takes damage, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.
A remove curse spell cast on the target ends the effect early. If the hexed creature drops to 0 hit points, Mytria regains the use of this ability.
Mytria is considered to be {@status concentration||concentrating} on this effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). They can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Animate Dead
entries: Each time a creature of a CR lower than the Necromancer's CR dies within 60 feet of it, then necromancer can animate it into a zombie.
The necromancer loses the use of this ability if the Jade necklace it wears around its neck is removed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer makes three necrotic burst attacks. Alternatively, they can make one necrotic burst attack, and cast one of their spells, use their Death Knell (if available), or activate a use of a spell (e.g. vampiric touch) as if they were using an action.

action.name: Necrotic Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) necrotic damage. If the target has less than half of its maximum hit points, the necromancer can reroll any result of 1 or 2 on the damage dice once.

action.name: Death Knell {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature of the necromancer's choice within 60 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, a creature also can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.
The necromancer can choose to target their own allies with this ability. For each ally killed by this damage, the necromancer gains 10 temporary hit points, up to a maximum of 30.

trait.name: Damnable Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the netherspawn, and can see it, must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage. If the creature fails its save by 5 or more, dark shadowy tendrils erupt from the ground and hold it in place. Its speed is 0 until the start of its next turn. A creature that fails its save by 10 or more is {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration instead.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The netherspawn is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Death's Mark
entries: When the netherspawn hits a creature, it can mark it for death. While marked, the target can't regain any hit points, has disadvantage on death saving throws, and the netherspawn has advantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, whenever the marked creature takes damage, the netherspawn regains 4 hit points. The mark lasts until it is removed by a remove curse spell or the netherspawn marks another target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The netherspawn makes three attacks.

action.name: Nether Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) necrotic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or come under the effects of the bestow curse spell.

action.name: Spawn Shadows {@recharge 5}
entries: The netherspawn brings forth unspeakable shadows in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on it. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage and become {@condition restrained} by the shadows for 1 minute. A creature that fails its save by 10 or more is {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration instead. Each creature {@condition restrained} by the shadows emits the same Damnable Aura as the netherspawn.

As a bonus action on each subsequent turn, the netherspawn can move a shadow, sending it at a creature within 30 feet of its original target. The original target is freed, but the new target must succeed on the same Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained}.

bonus.name: Shadow Step
entries: The netherspawn steps through shadows, teleporting up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, if that space is within darkness. Each creature within 5 feet of the netherspawn's point of origin or destination (its choice), must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage and be unable to use its reaction until the start of its next turn.
A creature that fails its save by 10 or more is unable to use its reaction for 1 minute instead, or until targeted by the remove curse spell.

reaction.name: Fleeing Shadows
entries: When a creature misses the netherspawn with an attack, it can teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it if that space is within darkness. Three shadowy tendrils are left in the netherspawn's position, which fly against the attacker. Make a ranged spell attack for each one (+9). On a hit, they take 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) necrotic damage and the netherspawn regains its reaction.

legendary.name: Villain Action 0: Extinguish Light
entries: Each light source within 120 feet of the netherspawn is extinguished, leaving a cold trail of smoke behind. Each creature within 15 feet of each light source takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage on a failed {@dc 17} Constitution save, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that holds a light source automatically fails this saving throw.

If the light's source is magical, and its spell level is 6th level or higher, the caster must succeed on a {@dc 17} spellcasting ability check or their light is extinguished. A creature that fails this saving throw is also unable to create magical light of any kind while it can see the netherspawn.

legendary.name: Villain Action 1: Darkened Visage
entries: The netherspawn creates an endless abyss of darkness under its hood. Any creature within 60 feet of it that isn't {@condition blinded} must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the netherspawn for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened}, a creature is unable to move away from the netherspawn instead of being unable to move towards it. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Villain Action 2: Ripples of Darkness
entries: The netherspawn sends ripples of darkness to assail each creature within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}. A {@condition blinded} creature can make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
For each creature that fails its save, the netherspawn can attempt to recharge its spawn shadows ability. A creature {@condition blinded} by these shadows has disadvantage on its saving throw.

legendary.name: Villain Action 3: Nethershadow Blast
entries: The netherspawn blasts an area with antideluvian shadows. Each creature in a 90-foot cone must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 66 ({@damage 12d10}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success. This damage can't be negated or prevented in any way. A creature {@condition restrained} by Spawned Shadows has disadvantage on this saving throw. A creature protect by a death ward spell has advantage on the save.

trait.name: Hide Spikes
entries: When a creature hits the Nidodrill with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. This ability is only active if the Nidodrill's Spike Cloud ability is charged.

trait.name: Goring Charge
entries: If the nidodrill moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 2d12}) piercing damage, and gains a moderate piercing wound ({@dice 1d6}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nidodrill makes two claw attacks or one gore attack. It can then use its Spike Cloud if it is available.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spike Cloud {@recharge 4}
entries: The Nidodrill launches all of the spines in its hide against nearby creatures. Any creatures within 20 feet of the Nidodrill must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that is further than 10 feet away from the Nidodrill takes half as much damage.

monster.name: Nightmare

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nightmare's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Nightmare's Scent
entries: With a mere glance, the nightmare can learn of a creature's last nightmares. Additionally, the nightmare knows of any fears or phobias the creature has, such as fear of heights, losing another loved one, or perishing alone.

Additionally, the nightmare can sense the direction of any {@condition frightened} creatures within 1000 feet of it, even if they are behind total cover, as their fear registers as a sweet odor to its nostrils.

trait.name: Power of Fear
entries: Whenever a creature makes a saving throw to resist becoming {@condition frightened} of the nightmare, it has disadvantage on the saving throw. Additionally, creatures within 30 feet of the nightmare have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

actionHeader: The nightmare makes a bite and a tail attack.

action.name: Spectral Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) psychic damage, and the nightmare becomes {@condition invisible} until the end of its turn.

action.name: Spectral Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) psychic damage. On a hit, if the nightmare was {@condition invisible} when it attacked, it can choose to also affect the creature with one of its spells. The target is automatically affected as if it had failed any saving throws, and the nightmare uses any resources that would have been necessary to cast the spell. The nightmare's invisibility doesn't end when it does so.

bonus.name: Nightmare Run {@recharge 5}
entries: The nightmare flies up to its movement speed without provoking any attacks of opportunity. Any creatures it flew by must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw if the nightmare flew at least 5 feet close to them. On a failed saving throw, a creature is {@condition frightened} of the nightmare for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

monster.name: Obsidian Beast

trait.name: Obsidian Hide
entries: A creature that misses with a melee weapon attack against the obsidian beast takes 3 slashing damage, as parts of its obsidian hide shatter.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the obsidian beast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d12} damage (included in the attack) and that target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

actionHeader: The obsidian beast makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage or 25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) if the beast uses its trampling charge.

action.name: Obsidian Shard
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shard Storm {@recharge}
entries: The obsidian beast launches obsidian shards against 3 targets it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 3d12}) piercing damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

If the target rolls a natural 1 on its save, or a 12 is rolled on any of the damage dice for a shard, that shard explodes on impact, dealing half as much damage to any creature within 5 feet of the target. A target can only take damage once from a shard storm.

monster.name: Ogre Painbringer

trait.name: Offense is the Best Defense
entries: When the ogre painbringer hits a creature with an attack, it gain a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Accustomed to Pain
entries: Whenever the painbringer takes damage, it can reduce the damage it takes by {@dice 1d12}. If it reduces the damage to 0, it can use its reaction to make an attack of opportunity against its attacker if it is within range, or it can gain a bonus to its AC equal to half of the number it rolled on the {@dice d12} (rounded down).

actionHeader: The ogre painbringer makes two giant mace attacks.

action.name: Giant Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Pain Willing
entries: When a melee attack misses the ogre, it can choose to aggressively step into the attack in order to retaliate. The attack instead hits the ogre, and it can use its reaction to make an attack of its own.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shaman's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Weak Minded
entries: The ogre makes concentration checks with disadvantage.

action.name: Push
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the orchid zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the orchid zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the start of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw. On a failure, it takes another 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage, and the orchid zombie regains half as many hit points if it is within 5 feet of the target. On a success, the effect ends.

action.name: Entangling Vines
entries: Vicious vines rise out of the ground and entangle up to two creatures the zombie can see within 60 feet of it. If a target is in contact with the ground, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice), or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the vines (escape {@dc 14}). On a successful saving throw, it takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as poisonous thorns tear its skin.

action.name: Noxious Spores {@recharge 5}
entries: The orchid zombie produces a cloud of necrotic spores that hover in the air in a 20-foot radius around it for 1 minute or until its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). When a creature starts its turn in the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition poisoned} while it remains in the cloud or until it succeeds on a subsequent saving throw.

Once a creature is {@condition poisoned}, it also contracts the Orchid plague a disease which can be removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic. When a creature dies while having the Orchid plague, it continues making death saving throws at the start of each of its turns. On the first failure, the creature rises as an orchid zombie under the GM's control. If it succeeds three times on the death saving throw, the Orchid plague does not take effect, but the creature remains dead.

monster.name: Orchid Nectar Carrier

trait.name: Pustules
entries: The nectar carrier is covered in pustules of nectar: a hideous substance lethal to living organisms but nourishing to the orchid zombies. When the nectar carrier takes damage, a pustule bursts, unless the damage was from an attack roll that exceeded the carrier's AC by 10 or more.

When a pustule bursts, each creature within 5 feet of it that isn't an orchid zombie must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity or Constitution saving throw (its choice) or take 5 poison damage. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more, it takes twice as much damage, becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute and contracts the Orchid plague.
If an orchid zombie is within 5 feet of the nectar carrier, it regains that many hit points instead when a pustule bursts.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the orchid nectar carrier to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the orchid nectar carrier drops to 1 hit point instead.

actionHeader: The orchid nectar carrier makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Meat Shield
entries: When an attack is made against an orchid zombie that is within 5 feet of the nectar carrier, the carrier can use its reaction to interpose itself between the attacker and the zombie. The attack targets the nectar carrier instead.

monster.name: Orchid Runner

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the orchid runner to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the orchid runner drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the orchid runner is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the orchid runner instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. The runner gains no use from this trait if its speed has been reduced to 0.

actionHeader: The leaf runner makes two slash attacks.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and be unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn.

bonus.name: Dash {@recharge 4}
entries: The orchid runner takes the dash action. When it does so, it is unimpeded by difficult terrain created by foliage or shrubbery, and it can pass through dense foliage that would otherwise be impassable.

reaction.name: Mobile Dodge
entries: When an attack is made against the runner, it can use its reaction, and expend the use of its dash ability, to gain a +5 bonus to its AC against the attack. If the attack misses, the runner can move up to half of its movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The orchid spider zombie has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle and forested terrain.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The orchid spider zombie has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}. The first hit the spider zombie makes against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The orchid spider zombie can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Additionally, the spider zombie doesn't take any fall damage from falling from a distance up to 60 feet if it is in jungle or forest terrain.

trait.name: Height Fall
entries: If the spider zombie falls towards a creature for a distance of at least 20 feet, and then hits it with a slam attack, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The spider zombie doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity from {@condition prone} creatures.

trait.name: Prone Vulnerability
entries: While the spider zombie is {@condition prone}, it has vulnerability to damage from melee weapon attacks.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the orchid spider zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the orchid spider zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the orchid strongarm zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the orchid strongarm zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Tilted
entries: If the zombie has damaged a creature since the start of its last turn, it has advantage on saving throws. Otherwise, it has disadvantage on saving throws.

trait.name: Frenzy
entries: When the strongarm zombie scores a critical hit with an attack, or reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it can use its bonus action to make another giant fist attack with advantage and it recharges its Invulnerable reaction.

action.name: Giant Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. While its Invulnerable reaction is charged, the zombie scores a critical hit on a 18-20.

reaction.name: Invulnerable (1/day)
entries: When the strongarm zombie would take damage or be moved against its will, it can use its reaction to reduce the damage it takes to 0 and stay in place.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The geist's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, to hit with spell attacks +9). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The patrician geist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Aura of Wispy Light
entries: The patrician geists emits an aura in a 5-foot radius around it. Any creature that is not undead and starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by an equal amount. The patrician geist then increases its current and maximum hit points by the same amount.

action.name: Curse
entries: The geist curses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. On a failed {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, the creature is unable to regain hit points until the curse is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: The geist magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Attack
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) damage if an allied creature is within 5 feet of the target.

bonus.name: Treat (1/Short or Long Rest)
entries: The grounder allows a creature it touches to regain a number of hit points equal to 2 rolls of its hit die + its Constitution modifier. Additionally, if the creature is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}, the condition on it ends.

reaction.name: Interpose
entries: When an allied creature within 5 feet of the grounder is targeted by an attack, the grounder can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack misses, the grounder can counterattack.

monster.name: Patrol Ranger

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The patrol ranger is trained to ride a Vulture Raptor, and has advantage on rolls made to remain mounted. Additionally, when the vulture takes damage, the ranger is able to absorb the damage instead. Additionally, while mounted, the ranger doesn't have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls if a creature is within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The patrol ranger makes two attacks.

action.name: Attack
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing or slashing damage.

bonusHeader: The patrol ranger can take the following bonus actions a total of 5 times per encounter.

bonus.name: Dash
entries: The patrol ranger takes the dash action and its movement doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity until the end of its turn. If the patrol is mounted, the mount can take the dash action.

bonus.name: Steady
entries: The patrol ranger gains advantage on all ranged attack and damage rolls until the end of its turn. To do so, it can't move at all during its turn.

bonus.name: Net
entries: The patrol ranger throws a net at a creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or become {@condition restrained} until a creature frees it by using its action to succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength or Dexterity check.

bonus.name: Treat
entries: The patrol ranger grants 10 temporary hit points to a creature that it can touch. If the creature is {@condition poisoned}, it can repeat the saving throw it made, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself on a success.

trait.name: Tracker
entries: The stalker has advantage on checks made to track a creature unseen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The patrol stalker makes two attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Gedrel-Tipped Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage. Until the tip of the dart is removed by a successful {@dc 13} Medicine check, the stalker can sense the direction of the target if it is within 1 mile of it.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The stalker can the dash, hide or disengage action as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When the stalker is hit by an attack, it can use its reaction to take half as much damage. It can then move up to 5 feet without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Arcane Sight
entries: The hound has advantage on perception checks made to notice any creature that can cast a spell. In addition, the hound's vision is sensitive to magical auras, as per the detect magic spell.

trait.name: Arcane-Powered
entries: A spellcaster can use their bonus action to touch the hound and expend a spell slot. The hound regains hit points equal to 5 times the spell slot's level.

If subjected to the dispel magic spell, the hound must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the spellcaster's spell DC or become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. The hound repeats the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If subjected to an anti-magic field, the hound becomes inert.

trait.name: Magic Alloy
entries: The pavlenko's hound has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Additionally, any time Pavlenko's hound is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the pavlenko's hound is unaffected. On a 6, the pavlenko's hound is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the pavlenko's hound, turning the caster into the target.
Additionally, when the hound rolls a 6, or succeeds on a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, it becomes charged. It can expend that charge in the following ways:
To gain a +5 bonus to its AC against an attack.
To deal an extra {@damage 2d8} force damage with an attack.
To double its movement speed for its turn.
To recharge its Lightning Bolt

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Bolt {@recharge 5}
entries: The hound spits out a bolt of lightning that forms a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Dies by Perfection
entries: The perfection modron can only be killed by using exact perfection. If the modron takes damage that reduces it to below 0 hit points, it doesn't die. Instead, it regains 21 hit points. The modron can only die if damage reduces it to exactly 0 hit points.

trait.name: Lives by Perfection
entries: When the modron makes an attack roll, it rolls a coin instead of a {@dice d20}. The modron either fails or scores a critical hit (included in the attack).

action.name: Perfect Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, as a critical hit.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The phaedran knight is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Souldrain
entries: The phaedran knight's weapon attacks are magical. When the knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, the target is marked until the end of the knight's next turn. While marked, the creature can't regain hit points if a knight is within 30 feet of it, and if it starts its turn within 5 feet of the knight, it loses 10 hit points, and the knight regains half as many hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two longsword or javelin attacks.

action.name: Souldrain Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shrouded Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) necrotic damage, and the target is sheathed in spiritual energy until the end of the knight's next turn. If the creature willingly moves until then, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the effect ends.

trait.name: Beast Bond
entries: While Pitrya is within 5 feet of her Jackal, she gains a +2 to her AC and saving throws, and her Jackal gains 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Spreading Ferocity
entries: When either Pitrya or her Jackal score a critical hit, the other can use their reaction to make an attack against the same target.

trait.name: Beastmastery
entries: Pitrya has 5 Beastmaster which she regains when she completes a short or long rest. She can expend them to activate the following features. She can only activate one feature per turn.

Aced Shot. When Pitrya makes a ranged attack against a creature within 5 feet of her Jackal, she can spend 1 point to gain advantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.
Animal Ferocity. When the Jackal forces a creature to make a saving throw, Pitrya can spend 1 point to impose disadvantage on the save.
Animal Endurance. When her Jackal takes damage, Pitrya can use her reaction to expend 1 point and cause her Jackal to take half as much damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Planebreaker is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Planebreaker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Planar Wards
entries: Creatures that are not native to the material realm have disadvantage on attack rolls against the planebreaker.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The planebreaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, the planebreaker can't be magically teleported against its will.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws against being magically teleported against its will for 1 minute.

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the behemoth takes damage, postules on its gigantic body erupt. If, at the end of each turn, the behemoth has taken damage, any creatures within 15 feet of the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage for each instance of damage the behemoth suffered.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the postule behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it can immediately choose to use one of its multiattack options.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Roll {@dice 1d8}. The Behemoth takes the equivalent action whenever it chooses during its turn.

action.name: 1. Stomp
entries: The behemoth stomps on the ground at a point within 15 feet of it. Any creatures in a 15-radius centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failed saving throw, a creature is also {@condition restrained} under the behemoth's foot until the behemoth moves or a creature succeeds on a {@dc 27} Strength check made to lift the behemoth's foot. A creature that begins its turn {@condition restrained} by the weight of the behemoth takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: 2. Earthquake
entries: The behemoth creates a brief earthquake around it, sending pieces of debris coming down. Any creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the behemoth must make a Dexterity saving throw. Each creature is affected as described based on its result:

0+. The creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition unconscious} as a large piece of debris impacts its head. A creature regains consciousness when it receives magical healing, or when a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 20} Medicine check.
5+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone}, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage and becoming {@condition restrained} under a piece of debris (escape {@dc 20}).
10+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone} and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage from debris impacts.
15+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
20+. The creature is thrown off balance by the tremors. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and attack rolls against it are made with advantage until the start of the behemoth's next turn.
25+. The creature is unaffected.

action.name: 3. Postule Breath
entries: The postule behemoth lets a number of postules near its mouth erupt as it inhales, letting out a devastating postule breath. Any creatures in a 60-foot cone originating from the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 52 ({@damage 8d12}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: 4. Poison Breath
entries: The postule behemoth lets out a breath of sickness and decay. Any creatures in a 60-foot cone originating from the behemoth, or any creature in a 20-foot radius from it (the behemoth's choice), must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage (half as much damage on a success) and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is also enfeebled and deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength while it is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: 5. Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition restrained} in the behemoth's jaws (escape {@dc 21}). While restraining a creature in this way, the behemoth can't use its Bite attack against another target.

A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes the full effects of the behemoth's breaths and takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns due to the behemoth's fumes.

action.name: 6. Swallow
entries: The behemoth swallows a creature that it is restraining with its jaws. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behemoth, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of the behemoth's turns.

If the behemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the behemoth. If the behemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: 7. Behemoth's Charge
entries: The postule behemoth charges 60 feet in a straight line. Any creatures in its path must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw to dodge out of its way (target's choice), or take 70 ({@damage 20d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. Afterwards, the ground in its path becomes difficult terrain for any creature other than the behemoth.

action.name: 8. Reroll
entries: Reroll an additional 2 times, selecting two results.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The behemoth moves up to its movement speed.

legendary.name: Postulous Sickness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The behemoth targets a creature within 60 feet of it. If the creature is already {@condition poisoned}, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, or it can't end the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself with an effect other than greater restoration or similar magic. If the creature isn't {@condition poisoned}, it becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour on a failed saving throw.

legendary.name: Behemoth Action (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The behemoth rolls on its multiattack table. It can choose to take the resulting action at any time until the start of its next turn. It can only take one action when it does so.

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the postule husk is hit by a melee attack by a creature within 5 feet of it, the attacker takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage as a postule on the husk erupts.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and become sickened for 1 minute. A sickened creature takes the same necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A {@condition poisoned} creature that is also sickened becomes vulnerable to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the postule servant would take damage, it can make a Constitution saving throw. If the result is higher than the amount of damage it would take, it instead takes no damage, and its attacker takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage if it is within 5 feet of the servant. If the servant is attached to a creature, the servant has advantage on its saving throw, and the creature takes the necrotic damage on a success.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the postule servant dies, it explodes in a burst of necrotic puss. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) necrotic damage, and the servant attaches to the target until a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength check to detach it. While attached, the servant has advantage on Constitution saving throws

monster.name: Prisma, Shimmering Arch-Angel

trait.name: Seeing Double
entries: When a creature that can see the shimmering angel starts its turn within 30 feet of the angel, the shimmering angel can force it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if the angel isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature begins seeing double for 1 minute.

While seeing double, a creature is unable to discern the exact location of creatures and objects around it, unless it has truesight, as everything is surrounded by hallucinatory duplicates of itself. When an affected creature targets a creature or object with an attack or spell, it has a 50% chance to target a hallucination, causing the attack or spell to automatically fail. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the angel until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the shimmering angel in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the angel's Spectacular Glimmer is active, its glimmering aura becomes too potent to ignore. Creatures that attempt look away from the shimmering angel must still make the saving throw, while a creature that looks directly at the angel during this time makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If a creature that is already seeing double fails the saving throw against this more potent glimmer, it becomes permanently blind. The condition can only be cured by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Spectacular Rebirth (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Prisma is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead she regains 200 hit points, recharges her Spectacular Glimmer and uses it.

This special Glimmer affects creatures in a 60-foot radius around the angel. While it is active, the shimmering angel gains 20 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns, and automatically succeeds on saving throws made to maintain concentration on the Glimmer.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Prisma has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shimmering angel makes two battleaxe attacks. It can replace up to 1 of its attacks with its spectacular glimmer.

action.name: Shimmering Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. On a critical hit, the target starts seeing double.

action.name: Prismatic Ray
