entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. On a hit, roll {@dice 1d8} to determine the color of the prismatic ray and its effects. On a critical hit, Prisma can select the type of ray, instead of dealing additional damage.
1. Red. The target takes {@damage 8d10} fire damage.
2. Orange. The target takes {@damage 8d10} acid damage.
3. Yellow. The target takes {@damage 8d10} lightning damage.
4. Green. The target takes {@damage 8d10} poison damage.
5. Blue. The target takes {@damage 8d10} cold damage.
6. Indigo. The target is {@condition restrained}. It can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
7. Violet. The target takes {@damage 8d10} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
8. The target takes {@damage 8d10} radiant damage and begins seeing double.

action.name: Spectacular Glimmer {@recharge 5}
entries: The shimmering angel lets out a wave of errant photonic energy, creating an overwhelming spectacle to the eyes. Any creature within 30 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or begin to see double. A creature also takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that makes this saving throw while already seeing double does so with disadvantage, and instead takes {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Such a creature also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw by 5 or more.

Additionally, the angel glimmers more brightly after using its Spectacular Glimmer, shedding bright light in a 30 foot radius around it. The effect lasts for 1 minute, or until the angel's concentration is broken (as if concentrating on the effect). The angel makes a Charisma saving throw to maintain concentration.

reaction.name: Blinding Glimmer
entries: When the angel sees a creature within 120 feet make an attack roll, it can use its reaction to grant disadvantage on the roll. If the creature is seeing double, it can instead automatically redirect its attack, selecting a different target of its choice.

legendary.name: Maintain Glimmer
entries: When the shimmering angel sees a creature succeed on its saving throw to stop seeing double, it can spend 1 Legendary Action to force the creature to reroll the saving throw. The creature must use the new roll.

The angel can also spend 1 Legendary Action to reroll a failed Charisma saving throw made to maintain concentration on its Glimmer. It must use the new roll. On a success, each creature of the angel's choice within 5 feet of it takes 10 radiant damage and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, or be pushed 15 feet away from the angel.

legendary.name: Brilliant Battleaxe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel makes a shimmering battleaxe attack. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if it is seeing double or the hit turns into a critical hit.

legendary.name: Radiant Blink (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Prisma teleports at an unoccupied space she can see within range. Any creatures within 15 feet of her origin or destination point (her choice) must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 10 radiant damage (half on a success) and have disadvantage on saving throws made against her Seeing Double ability.

legendary.name: Prismatic Ray (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Prisma makes a prismatic ray attack.

mythicHeader: If the Prisma's Mythic trait is active, she has a total of 5 Legendary Actions available to her, and can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Prismatic Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel covers itself in a prismatic veil, forming a shell of colorful energy around its body. While covered in this shield, the angel is heavily obscured, and the first time that it is hit by an attack, the shield detonates sending prismatic energy towards the attacker. Roll {@dice 1d8} to determine the color of the light and its effects:
1. Red. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage.
2. Orange. The target takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage.
3. Yellow. The target takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage.
4. Green. The target takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage.
5. Blue. The target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage.
6. Indigo. The creature is {@condition restrained}. It can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
7. Violet. The creature takes {@damage 6d6} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
8. Roll twice on the table, keeping both results.

mythic.name: Cone of Brilliance (Costs 5 Actions)
entries: The angel releases a 60-foot cone of brilliance in the direction of its choice. Any creatures in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage or half as much damage on a success. On a failed saving throw, roll a {@dice d4}. On a 2-4, the creature begins to See Double permanently. On a 1, the creature is permanently {@condition blinded}.
The area then becomes overcharged with shimmering energy. For the next minute, any creature that is dealt radiant damage while in the overcharged area is considered to be vulnerable to it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pyromancer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). He can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Snuff
entries: The pyromancer can immediately snuff out any flaming creatures or objects that he has ignited (e.g. with his fire blast). The effect ends, and the pyromancer gains 10 temporary hit points for each ignited target snuffed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyromancer makes three fire blast attacks. Alternatively, he makes one fire blast attack and casts one of his spells, or uses his Fiery Inferno.

action.name: Fire Blast
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) fire damage. The pyromancer can then choose to either ignite the target, causing it to take {@damage 1d10} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until a creature uses its action to put out the fire, or to let the blast bloom into a 10-foot-radius explosion, dealing {@damage 1d10} fire damage to all creatures in the area (except the target).

action.name: Fiery Inferno (Concentration)
entries: The pyromancer creates a fiery inferno in a 30-foot cube centered on a point on the ground that he can see within 120 feet of him. The conjured flames burn so hot that any creature that enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage, or half as much damage on a success. At the end of each of the pyromancer's turns, the inferno's area expands by an additional 5 cubic feet.

bonus.name: Firey Envelope {@recharge 5}
entries: The pyromancer envelops himself in flames and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see on the ground within 60 feet. He can choose to unleash a torrent of flames either after his arrival, or before his departure. Each creature within 10 feet of the point he arrives in or departs from must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

monster.name: Pythosarc

trait.name: Fragmentary Armor
entries: Whenever the phythosarc is hit by an attack, its AC is lowered by 1, and if the attacker is within 5 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 piercing damage.

actionHeader: The pythosarc makes a claw attack and then a pincer bite attack.

action.name: Pincer Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become infected by black bile. An infected creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, and takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the creature is infected by black bile, each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ragul's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). He can cast the following spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ragul makes two attacks. If he scores a critical hit or kills a creature with an attack, he gains 10 temporary hit points and makes a third attack.

action.name: Fiendfire Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Eldritch Casting {@recharge 5}
entries: Ragul casts a spell using a bonus action.

reaction.name: Sentinel Strike
entries: Ragul can use his reaction to make an attack of opportunity even if a creature has taken the disengage action. On a hit, the creature's speed is reduced to 0. Ragul can also make an opportunity attack when a creature within his reach attacks one of his allies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ringer's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). They can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Toll the Fiends
entries: Fiends can't reduce or prevent the damage they take from a ringer's toll the dead in any way. Additionally, when a ringer damages a fiend with toll the dead, the fiend becomes marked. The next mallet attack against it is made with advantage. Only one creature can be marked at a time.

action.name: Mallet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Turn Fiends (1/Day)
entries: The ringer strikes their bell, speaking an incantation that censures fiends. Each fiend that can see or hear them within 30 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from them as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

monster.name: Roslock

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Roslock is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell {@dc 17}, to hit with spell attacks +9). He can cast the following spells at 5th level unless they are of a higher level.

trait.name: Resilient Mind
entries: Roslock has advantage on concentration checks.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Roslock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actionHeader: Roslock makes three blast spell attacks.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell until the end of Roslock's next turn.

action.name: Replacing Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or it and Roslock exchange places.

action.name: Collapsing Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) force damage and each creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 5 force damage and be pulled up to 10 feet towards the target.

trait.name: Runner
entries: The running thing doesn't provoke an attack of opportunity from the first creature it would provoke an attack during its turn.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the running thing dies, it explodes in a burst of poison and black bile. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The running thing's body then collapses into a pile of black bile that occupies the space of the running thing. Each creature that enters the space of the bile or starts its turn there must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take the same damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become infected by black bile. While infected, a creature is {@condition poisoned} and takes 4 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: Solvos can take the Hide, or Disengage actions as a bonus action.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) sneak damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When Solvos takes damage, he can use his reaction to take half damage and immediately move up to half of his movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Alternatively, if a melee attack misses Salvos, he can use his reaction to move 5 feet away from his attacker without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Shadow Blood
entries: Shadows run in the veins of the shadowblood. When it takes bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, a coat of darkness pours out of its open wound, creating a 5-foot area of magical darkness. The aura remains for 1 minute, or until dispelled by a spell of 3rd level or higher which creates light.
If the shadowblood bleeds in an existing area of darkness, the area's dimensions expand by an additional 5 feet as more darkness pours into the aura.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shadowblood's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadowblood makes two dark claws attacks.

action.name: Dark Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Shadow Teleport {@recharge 4}
entries: The shadowblood teleports to an unoccupied space of magical darkness it can see within 120 feet.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadowblood prince's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Shadow Blood
entries: Shadows run in the veins of the shadowblood. When it takes bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, a coat of darkness pours out of its open wound, creating a 10-foot area of magical darkness. The aura remains for 1 minute, or until dispelled by a spell of 3rd level or higher which creates light.
If the shadowblood bleeds in an existing area of darkness, the area's dimensions expand by an additional 10 feet as more darkness pours into the aura.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shadowblood's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadowblood makes two dark claws or shadowbolt attacks.

action.name: Dark Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadowbolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Shadow Teleport {@recharge 4}
entries: The shadowblood teleports to an unoccupied space of magical darkness it can see within 120 feet.

trait.name: Seeing Double
entries: When a creature that can see the shimmering angel starts its turn within 30 feet of the angel, the shimmering angel can force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the angel isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature begins seeing double for 1 minute.

While seeing double, a creature is unable to discern the exact location of creatures and objects around it, unless it has truesight, as everything is surrounded by hallucinatory duplicates of itself. When an affected creature targets a creature or object with an attack or spell, it has a 50% chance to target a hallucination, causing the attack or spell to automatically fail. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the angel until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the shimmering angel in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the angel is shedding intense bright light after using its glimmer, its glimmering aura becomes too potent to ignore. Creatures that attempt look away from the shimmering angel must still make the saving throw, while a creature that looks directly at the angel during this time makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If a creature that is already seeing double fails the saving throw against this more potent glimmer, it becomes permanently blind. The condition can only be cured by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shimmering angel makes two battleaxe attacks. It can replace up to 1 of its attacks with its spectacular glimmer.

action.name: Shimmering Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. On a critical hit, the target starts seeing double.

action.name: Spectacular Glimmer {@recharge 5}
entries: The shimmering angel lets out a wave of errant photonic energy, creating an overwhelming spectacle to the eyes. Any creature within 30 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or begin to see double. A creature also takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that makes this saving throw while already seeing double does so with disadvantage, and instead takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Such a creature also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw by 5 or more.

Additionally, the angel glimmers more brightly after using its Spectacular Glimmer, shedding bright light in a 30 foot radius around it. The effect lasts for 1 minute, or until the angel's concentration is broken (as if concentrating on the effect). The angel makes a Charisma saving throw to maintain concentration.

legendary.name: Maintain Glimmer
entries: When the shimmering angel sees a creature succeed on its saving throw to stop seeing double, it can spend 1 Legendary Action to force the creature to reroll the saving throw. The creature must use the new roll.
The angel can also spend 1 Legendary Action to reroll a failed Charisma saving throw made to maintain concentration on its Glimmer. It must use the new roll.

legendary.name: Confusingly Brilliant Battleaxe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel makes a shimmering battleaxe attack. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if it is seeing double or the hit turns into a critical hit.

trait.name: Acidic Breath
entries: When the siren monster opens its jaws to attack, it expels acid from its mouth. Whether it hits or misses, the 5-foot area the target occupies becomes covered by acid for 1 minute. Any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there takes {@damage 2d4} acid damage.

action.name: Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Trail of Acid (1/day)
entries: The siren monster moves up to twice its movement speed, leaving a trail of acid up to 80 feet long behind it. The acid remains for 1 minute, and any creature that enters its space or starts its turn there takes {@damage 5d8} acid damage. The siren monster is immune to its own acid.

action.name: Hypnotic Calling {@recharge 5}
entries: The siren monster emits an eldritch sound that carries up to 120 feet in water. Any creature that hears the sound must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it becomes {@condition charmed} for 1 hour and must use its action and movement speed to move towards the origin of the sound. The creature remains {@condition charmed} until it touches the siren monster, or until it takes any damage from it or its allies. If the {@condition charmed} creature takes damage from any other source, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

monster.name: Skalla Wolf

immune.note: from non-magical attacks that aren't silvererd

languages: Understands the languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The skalla wolf can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the skalla wolf can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) cold damage, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls it makes until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Skalla Aura (Recharge After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skalla wolf begins emitting an aura that suppresses bloodthirsty emotions in creatures of its choice for 1 minute. While the skalla wolf concentrates on this effect, the aura extends out to a range of 30 feet around it. The first time an affected creature attempts to take the attack action during its turn, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature cannot take the attack action until the end of its current turn.

Skalla wolves are spirits of humanoid creatures that died with the seed of remorse in their heart about evil deeds they had done. They remain behind in the material plane as a second chance to change their soul before moving on.

trait.name: Soul Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Intrusive Echoes
entries: Any creature that starts its turn occupying the same space as the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the confusion spell for 1 minute, as echoes of multiple souls whisper nonsensical things into its mind. If an affected creature ends its turn outside the area of the elemental, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Destabilizing Form
entries: When a creature hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Soul Gathering {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental attempts to disturb the equilibrium that the soul has with its body. Any creatures occupying the same space as the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or fall {@condition unconscious}. While {@condition unconscious}, the soul of the creature is sucked into the elemental. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the creature fails 3 of these saving throws, the soul is permanently absorbed into the elemental. This effect can also end with the remove curse or dispel evil and good spells, or similar magic.

While the creature's soul is sucked into the elemental, it can use its influence to attempt to determine a confused creature's actions. Once per round, the creature can make a {@dc 15} Charisma check when another creature begins its turn confused by the elemental. On a success, the creature decides the outcome of the {@dice d10} roll, instead of rolling.

trait.name: Destabilizing Form
entries: When a creature hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myrmidon makes three spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) force damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) force damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Soul Attack {@recharge}
entries: The myrmidon makes one spear attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} until the myrmidon's next turn.

reaction.name: Spiritual Rebuke
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the myrmidon hits it with a melee attack, the myrmidon can make a spear attack against it as a reaction or it can use its Soul Attack if it is available.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Spectra's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell attack +8, spell save {@dc 16}). She can cast the following spells. When Spectra causes a creature to be blinded with one of these spells, she can instead cause them to start Seeing Double.

trait.name: Prismatic Sense
entries: Spectra has an innate connection with light and its prismatic nature. She can innately cast the light spell without requiring an action.

While in bright light, Spectra has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are seeing double, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, Spectra's movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: When Spectra takes radiant damage, her attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage until the end of her next turn. Additionally, she can refract the light with her shield. A creature of her choice within 30 feet of Spectra must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or begin Seeing Double.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Spectra makes three scimitar attacks. If she scores a critical hit, she can make an additional shimmering scimitar attack. Spectra can only use its shimmering scimitar if she is in bright light.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if Spectra is in bright light.

action.name: Shimmering Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if Spectra is in bright light, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or begin Seeing Double. If the ward hits with this attack, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it can't use this action again unless its Multiattack allows it to.

legendary.name: Chromatic Blink
entries: Spectra becomes {@condition invisible} to any creature who is Seeing Double until the end of her next turn.

legendary.name: Shimmering Scimitar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Spectra makes a shimmering scimitar attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Spectra casts a spell. If Spectra casts a cantrip, she expends 2 Legendary Actions instead.

trait.name: Spike Rack
entries: When a creature makes a melee attack against the spike hound while within 5 feet of it, it takes 5 piercing damage. If the hound has less than half of its maximum hit points, the creature doesn't take any damage, as the spikes have been cut off.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the spike hound moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage if the target is {@condition prone}. Additionally, if the target is {@condition prone}, the attack is automatically a critical hit, and if the spike hound reduces a creature to 0 hit points with its bite while the target is {@condition prone}, the creature dies.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Heavy Carrier
entries: The stalker can carry medium or smaller creatures while flying without a penalty to its movement speed.

trait.name: Wing Cover
entries: At the start of its turn, if the stalker isn't flying, it can choose to use its wings as protective cover. Until the start of its next turn, it has half cover from ranged attacks. If it is hit by a ranged attack, however, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be unable to fly until the end of its next turn. The DC is equal to half of the damage it takes.

action.name: Spine Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on an Athletics check against the stalker's attack roll, or it becomes {@condition grappled}. While {@condition grappled}, the creature is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Spinal Tap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target the stalker is grappling and restraining with its talons. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target receives one point of spinal damage. Depending on the amount of points a creature has, it incurs additional effects which last permanently or until the points are removed with a greater restoration spell or higher magic.
1. The creature's speed is halved.
2. The creature's speed is 0.
3. The creature is {@condition paralyzed}.
4. The creature dies and the stalker removes its spine. The stalker regains hit points equal to the damage it dealt.

bonus.name: Tail Attack {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage, and the stalker regains hit points equal to the damage it dealt.

reaction.name: Tail Slash
entries: When the spine stalker provokes an attack of opportunity while flying, it can use its reaction to make an attack of opportunity with its tail. To do so, the enemy must make an attack of opportunity as well.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The striker's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). He can cast the following spells:

4: {@spell hold person} (roll 1d6 to determine the level)

trait.name: Disciplined Mind
entries: The striker has advantage on Mental saving throws and checks made to maintain his concentration.

trait.name: Hypnotic Aura (Concentration)
entries: As an action, the striker can turn on and off an aura that can hypnotize nearby creatures. Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the striker must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or come under the effects of the hypnotic pattern spell. If the striker's concentration is broken, the effect ends for all creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The striker makes two attacks. The striker can't make two pinch attacks against the same target.

action.name: Neck Pinch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution or Wisdom saving throw (target's choice) or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to shake it awake.

action.name: Neurological Toxin Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) poison damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution or Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned}, a creature's movement speed is halved, as it has trouble balancing.

reaction.name: Hypnotic Block
entries: When the striker is targeted by a melee attack, he can use his reaction to force to attacker to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature loses its attack and can't attack the enforcer for the rest of its turn. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to this effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The striker's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). She can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Illusory Camouflage
entries: The enforcer can actively camouflage themselves using illusory magic. Doing so requires concentration, and grants them advantage on Dexterity (Stealth checks).

trait.name: Charming Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the striker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by her for 1 minute or until she or her companions harm the target. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw, or has the effect end on it, is immune to the effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The striker makes two attacks.

action.name: Illusory Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) psychic damage. If the striker attacks a creature that hasn't been hit by the illusory blade, she has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Illusory Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/90 ft., one target or two targets adjacent to one another. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Disappear
entries: When an attack misses the striker, she can use her reaction to cast the invisibility spell and move up to her speed.

trait.name: Enhance Strength (Concentrate)
entries: As a bonus action, the striker can use its cybernetic implants to enhance its strength. It gains advantage on Strength checks and saving throws and its attacks deal extra damage equal to its Strength modifier (4). The effects lasts for 1 minute, or until its concentration is broken.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the striker moves at least 30 feet straight towards a creature, and then hits it with a Cybernetic Arm attack, the striker can automatically push the target 30 feet away from them, knocking them {@condition prone}, and dealing an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. The striker must be under the effects of his enhance strength or burst of speed in order to do so.

If the creature impacts a wall or other obstacle that stops its movement earlier, roll {@dice 1d6} for each 5 feet of movement that was averted. The two targets each take half as much bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The striker makes two attacks.

action.name: Cybernetic Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the striker can either knock the target 5 feet away from them, or knock it {@condition prone}. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, the striker can inflict both effects.

bonus.name: Burst of Speed (Cooldown 1)
entries: The striker dashes forward with incredible speed. His speed is doubled for this round, his jump distance is tripled, and his movement doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity. He must then succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, or his movement speed is halved until he regains use of this bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The terramancer's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). They can cast the following spells:

trait.name: One With Stone
entries: While the terramancer is in contact with the ground, he gains the following benefits. He can also cast the mold earth spell at will.
1. His AC is 18
2. He has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

3. He can move through solid earth or stone as if it was air and without destabilizing it. The terramancer can stay inside the earth for a maximum of 5 rounds before he suffocates (1 + his Constitution modifier).

Each time a successful {@dc 15} dispel magic spell is cast on the terramancer (roll always required), the terramancer loses one by one of these effects in order, which he regains when he finishes a rest. For each casting of dispel magic, the DC increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The terramancer makes three rock launch attacks. Alternatively, he makes one rock launch attack, and casts one of his spells or uses his Erupt Earth.

action.name: Rock Launch
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Erupt Earth {@recharge 5}
entries: The terramancer churns the earth in a 60-foot cube within range. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}, taking half as much damage on a success without being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} creature is then churned through the earth, being buried beneath it. A buried creature is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained} and begins suffocating while buried. Note the initial damage dealt to the creature by the effect. Those are the difficulty points of the challenge to dig itself out. A creature can make a Strength check to progress the challenge.
Creatures that are specifically unaffected by difficult terrain made of earth or stone (e.g. earth elementals) are unaffected by this effect.

The area then becomes difficult terrain. Any creature that takes a dash action in this area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Acrobatics check or fall {@condition prone} and have its movement reduced to 0 for the rest of its turn.

monster.name: Thistle Lion

trait.name: Thistle Fur
entries: The lion's fur and head is covered by keratin-like protrusions. When a creature attacks the thistle lion while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 piercing damage.
This trait does not function if the lion's Thistle Spray is not charged. If the Thistle Spray is not charged, the lion can't use its Thistle Tail either.

actionHeader: The thistle lion makes a claw and a bite attack. If both attacks hit a single target, it recharges its Thistle Spray, and can immediately use it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thistle Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The lion swells its head and shoots out its thistles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage, or half as much damage on a success.

bonus.name: Thistle Tail (Available Only If Thistle Spray is Charged)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Thrasta's innate spellcating ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thrasta makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her tail. She can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target. When a creature starts its turn while being {@condition restrained} in Thrasta's jaws, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) lightning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Storm Sphere {@recharge 5}
entries: Thrasta emits the spirit of the tempest in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on her, which moves with her. Any creatures within the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

The sphere lasts for 1 minute, or until Thrasta's concentration is broken, as if concentrating on a spell. For the duration, the area is difficult terrain for any creature other than Thrasta, and any creature other than her that ends its turn within the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Storm Bolt (Storm Sphere Only)
entries: While Thrasta's Storm Sphere is active, she can use a bonus action to send a bolt of lightning towards a creature within the sphere's area. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d)6 lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more also can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. A creature that fails this saving throw by 10 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of Thrasta's next turn.

legendary.name: Lightning Lure
entries: Thrasta casts lightning lure against a creature within range. If her Storm Sphere is active, she can target any creature within her sphere.

legendary.name: Storm Bolt
entries: If Thrasta's Storm Sphere is active, she can take her Storm Bolt action.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Thrasta makes a tail attack. On a hit, the target is also knocked {@condition prone}. If it is already {@condition prone}, it takes twice as much lightning damage.

legendary.name: Storm Sphere (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Thrasta recharges her Storm Sphere and uses it. Any affected creatures have disadvantage on the initial saving throw.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The time spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Temporal Field
entries: The time spirit emits a temporal field in a 10-foot radius around it. The time spirit can choose what creatures to affect with this field. When a creature enters the field for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer the effects of the slow spell until the start of its next turn, or until it is no longer in the temporal field.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The time spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Time's Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} Roll {@damage 1d6 + 4 + summonSpellLevel}. The target ages by a number of days equal to the damage it takes.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The transmuter wizard's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). They can cast the following spells:

action.name: Poison Spray
entries: The transmuter wizard projects a puff of noxious gas from their palm, targeting up to 2 creatures which must be within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 3d12}) poison or acid damage. On a failure, roll a {@dice d4}. The target also suffers the following effect until the end of their next turn, unless they are immune to poison damage:
1. The creature is {@condition poisoned}.
2. The creature is {@condition blinded}.
3. The creature is confused, as per the confusion spell.
4. The creature is knocked {@condition prone} in a coughing fit, and can't stand up, speak or cast spells with a verbal component until the effect ends.

action.name: Noxious Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) poison or acid damage. Whether the attack succeeds or fails, the wizard can then choose for the noxious blast to bloom outward from the target. Each creature within 10 feet of the target (including it) must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking the same amount of damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

bonus.name: Rejuvenate
entries: The transmuter gains 10 ({@dice 3d4 + 3}) temporary hit points, if at least one hostile creature is within 5 feet of them.

reaction.name: Reactive Resilience {@recharge 5}
entries: When the transmuter wizard takes damage, they can use their reaction to gain resistance to that type of damage, including against the triggering effect. The resistance lasts until they use this feature to change it again.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Victor Sveran's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He can emulate the effects of the following spells without requiring any verbal components. Victor is not considered to be casting a spell when he does so, but the effects are considered to be magical.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Victor Sveran deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Victor Sveran that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Victor Sveran doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Victor Sveran has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Victor Sveran is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Victor makes two medical scalpel attacks. He can substitute one of these attacks with a hand crossbow attack.

action.name: Medical Scalpel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage. This attack ignores any resistances to slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Uncanny Action: Analyze
entries: Victor uses his bonus action to analyze the movements of a creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature is analyzed by Victor for the next minute, or until Victor analyzes another target.
Victor can use his sneak attack damage against any creature he is analyzing, and he has advantage on saving throws that the analyzed creature forces Victor to make.

reaction.name: Uncanny Skin
entries: When victor is hit by an attack, he can use his reaction to halve the damage he takes from it. Additionally, if the attacker made a melee weapon attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, or its weapon becomes embedded in Victor's skin, unable to be used until a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength check to pull it free.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Victor moves up to his movement speed without provoking any attacks of opportunity. He can then hide if he is out of sight of any hostile creature.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Victor makes an attack.

legendary.name: Revitalize (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Victor gains 20 temporary hit points if no hostile creature is adjacent to him, or 10 temporary hit points if at least one hostile creature is adjacent to him. When he does so, each creature of his choice within 5 feet of him must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a hostile creature takes 10 necrotic damage. On a success, a friendly creature gains as many temporary hit points as Victor gained.

trait.name: Fear Echolocation
entries: The visage is able to navigate its surroundings by sensing the fear and emotions of its potential victims. Any creature who is immune to effects that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts is shielded from the visage's senses, and the visage is considered to be blind to it.

trait.name: Fear, Embodied
entries: The visage of fear can instill deep dread in the heart of any mortal. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the visage must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it. If an affected creature ends its turn outside of the visage's fear aura, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Creatures that can see the visage when it is {@condition invisible} have disadvantage on their saving throw.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The visage of fear can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The visage makes two take hold attacks.

action.name: Take Hold
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the creature is {@condition frightened} or {@condition paralyzed}, the attack automatically hits, and the target begins suffocating. The visage can only grapple one creature at a time.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The visage of fear turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell or uses this action again. Creatures that are {@condition frightened} can still see the visage, even when it is {@condition invisible}.

If the visage uses this action while {@condition invisible}, it reveals itself to any creatures of its choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the visage's next turn.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

trait.name: Deprive Life (Nihilistic Only)
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the void spirit can't regain hit points. Also, at the start of each of the void spirit's turns, each creature within 5 feet of the void spirit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The void spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Dark Contact (Nihilistic Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} Roll {@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel}. The target loses that many hit points and has its maximum hit points reduced by an equal amount.

action.name: Mind-Reeling Contact (Boundless Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} psychic damage.

reaction.name: Overpower Mind (Boundless Only)
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the void spirit makes an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, the spirit can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on that save.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The vulture raptor has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Nimble Feet
entries: The vulture raptor can walk across incredibly narrow ledges, thanks to its balance, and opportunity attacks against it have disadvantage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The apprentice's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Arcane Influence (1/Turn)
entries: When the apprentice damages a creature with a spell or spell attack, it can force it to suffer one of the following effects:
1. The target can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.
2. The target has disadvantage on the next save they make against a spell.
3. The next spell attack made against the target is made with advantage.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk rs, ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) force damage.

bonus.name: Prodigial Caster (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The apprentice casts one of its spells as a bonus action.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the young red infernal dragon's darkvision.

trait.name: Devil's Claws
entries: When the young red infernal dragon reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it gains 10 temporary hit points and that creature has disadvantage on death saving throws while it remains at 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Draconic Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Draconic Presence
entries: The dragon uses one of the following auras.

items.name: Frightful Presence
items.entry: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Tyrant's Presence
items.entry: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or come under the effects of the command spell. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Tyrant's Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Tail {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. If it detects a creature that was previously hidden, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack. On a hit, the dragon can expend an additional legendary action to deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage with the attack, and ignite the target. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on a failure. On a success the effect ends.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Damage Absorption
entries: You might decide that this dragon is not only unharmed by fire damage, but actually healed by it.
Whenever the dragon is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense}.

fluff.name: Adult Red Dragon

entries: The most covetous of the true dragons, red dragons tirelessly seek to increase their treasure hoards. They are exceptionally vain, even for dragons, and their conceit is reflected in their proud bearing and their disdain for other creatures. The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry. Its wings are the longest of any chromatic dragon, and have a blue-black tint along the trailing edge that resembles metal burned blue by fire.

The scales of a red dragon wyrmling are a bright glossy scarlet, turning a dull, deeper red and becoming as thick and strong as metal as the dragon ages. Its pupils also fade as it ages, and the oldest red dragons have eyes that resemble molten lava orbs.

entries.name: Mountain Masters
entries: Red dragons prefer mountainous terrain, badlands, and any other locale where they can perch high and survey their domain. Their preference for mountains brings them into conflict with the hill-dwelling copper dragons from time to time.

entries.name: Arrogant Tyrants
entries: Red dragons fly into destructive rages and act on impulse when angered. They are so ferocious and vengeful that they are regarded as the archetypical evil dragon by many cultures.

No other dragon comes close to the arrogance of the red dragon. These creatures see themselves as kings and emperors, and view the rest of dragonkind as inferior. Believing that they are chosen by Tiamat to rule in her name, red dragons consider the world and every creature in it as theirs to command.

entries.name: Status and Slaves
entries: Red dragons are fiercely territorial and isolationist. However, they yearn to know about events in the wider world, and they make use of lesser creatures as informants, messengers, and spies. They are most interested in news about other red dragons, with which they compete constantly for status.

When it requires servants, a red dragon demands fealty from chaotic evil humanoids. If allegiance isn't forthcoming, it slaughters a tribe's leaders and claims lordship over the survivors. Creatures serving a red dragon live in constant terror of being roasted and eaten for displeasing it. They spend most of their time fawning over the creature in an attempt to stay alive.

entries.name: Obsessive Collectors
entries: Red dragons value wealth above all else, and their treasure hoards are legendary. They covet anything of monetary value, and can often judge the worth of a bauble to within a copper piece at a glance. A red dragon has a special affection for treasure claimed from powerful enemies it has slain, exhibiting that treasure to prove its superiority.

A red dragon knows the value and provenance of every item in its hoard, along with each item's exact location. It might notice the absence of a single coin, igniting its rage as it tracks down and slays the thief without mercy. If the thief can't be found, the dragon goes on a rampage, laying waste to towns and villages in an attempt to sate its wrath.

entries.name: A Red Dragon's Lair
entries: Red dragons lair in high mountains or hills, dwelling in caverns under snow-capped peaks, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized red dragon lairs, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a dragon as it sleeps. With its hoard well protected deep within the lair, a red dragon spends as much of its time outside the mountain as in it. For a red dragon, the great heights of the world are the throne from which it can look out to survey all it controls-and the wider world it seeks to control.
Throughout the lair complex, servants erect monuments to the dragon's power, telling the grim story of its life, the enemies it has slain, and the nations it has conquered.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the dragon takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the dragon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Magma erupts from a point on the ground the dragon can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 20-foot-high, 5-foot-radius geyser. Each creature in the geyser's area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A tremor shakes the lair in a 60-foot radius around the dragon. Each creature other than the dragon on the ground in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Volcanic gases form a cloud in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Additional Lair Actions
entries: At your discretion, a legendary ({@creature Adult Red Dragon||adult} or {@creature Ancient Red Dragon||ancient}) red dragon can use one or both of the following additional lair actions while in its lair:

items.name: Noxious Smoke
items.entry: A cloud of thick, dark smoke fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is {@book heavily obscured|PHB|8|Vision and Light}. A creature other than the dragon that starts its turn in the cloud or enters it for the first time on its turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its turn. The cloud lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.

items.name: Searing Heat
items.entry: Searing heat spreads out in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of it. Any creature that enters the affected area or starts its turn there must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The heat lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a legendary red dragon's lair is warped by the dragon's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Small earthquakes are common within 6 miles of the dragon's lair.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally warm and tainted by sulfur.
Rocky fissures within 1 mile of the dragon's lair form portals to the Elemental Plane of Fire, allowing creatures of elemental fire into the world to dwell nearby.

entries: If the dragon dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

entries.name: Additional Regional Effects
entries: Any of these effects might appear in the area around a red dragon's lair, in addition to or instead of the effects described in the {@i Monster Manual}:

items.name: Desertification
items.entry: Precipitation is almost nonexistent within 6 miles of the dragon's lair, making the land parched and arid and most plant life withered and brown.

items.name: Fiery Senses
items.entry: The dragon can hear up to 30 feet through any open flame within 1 mile of the dragon's lair.

items.name: Ominous Flames
items.entry: Open flames within 6 miles of the dragon's lair are tinged dark red, hiss and crackle constantly, and throw off embers and showers of sparks.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Ythrox can use his action to polymorph into a red dragonborn, or back into his true form. His statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is transformed with him. He reverts to his true form if he dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ythrox makes two attacks: one with his bite and one with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. If the attack roll exceeds the target's armor class by 5 or more, Ythrox can choose to grapple the target with his jaws. While grappling a target, he deals an extra weapon damage die whenever he hits it with an attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Roar of Challenge (1/day)
entries: Ythrox can use his bonus action to unleash a challenging roar of anger and dominance against a creature he can see within 120 feet of him, if that creature is related to his Ego bond or Challenger flaw in some way. When he does so, his speed is doubled for this turn.
The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute, or until it succeeds on a repeated saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

Whether the target succeeds or fails, Ythrox can maintain the challenge, entering into a frenzy for a fight for dominance. The challenge lasts for the next minute or until his concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell), and while it is active, Ythrox has the following benefits against the target:
Ythrox can take the dash action as a bonus action if he moves straight towards his challenger, and his attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to them.

If he attacks his challenger, he can choose to make all of his attacks against them this turn with advantage. If he does so, attacks against Ythrox from creatures other than his challenger are made with advantage until the start of his next turn.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Damage Absorption
entries: You might decide that this dragon is not only unharmed by fire damage, but actually healed by it.
Whenever the dragon is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
The dragon doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

items.name: Mimicry
entries: Impersonating characters or their allies could be a fun trick for a crafty dragon.
The dragon can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

items.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You might decide that dragons in your campaign, being an essential part of the Material Plane, are nearly impossible to destroy. A dragon's life essence might be preserved in the egg from which it first emerged, in its hoard, or in a cavernous hall at the center of the world, just as a lich's essence is hidden in a phylactery.

If it has an essence-preserving object, a destroyed dragon gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the object.

items.name: Special Senses
entries: Most dragons have {@sense blindsight} and {@sense darkvision}. You might upgrade {@sense blindsight} to {@sense truesight}, or you could give a dragon with a burrowing speed {@sense tremorsense|MM}.
